creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: profile of a young figure in robes and a pointed hat with a train hanging down back; drinking from flat shell-like vessel
marks: Mark written in plate, in reverse, upper left: [Rembr-a
provenance: Gustav Friedrich Konstantin Parthey (1798-1872), sale 1895; [C. & J. Goodfriend, New York, until February 13, 1986; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Standing Youth Drinking from a Cup
